title: Environmental Studies
author: Md. Habibur Rahman
description: This book on Environmental Studies is specially designed for diploma engineering students to build awareness about environmental issues. It covers pollution, natural resources, ecosystems, biodiversity, and sustainable development with practical examples tailored to the local context of Bangladesh.

title: Programming in Java
author: Md. Al Amin
description: A practical guide to learning Java for diploma students, this book introduces object-oriented programming, basic syntax, control structures, arrays, classes, inheritance, interfaces, applets, and exception handling. It follows the polytechnic curriculum and provides numerous coding examples and exercises.

title: Digital Electronics-2
author: Md. Hasan
description: Digital Electronics-2 offers in-depth knowledge about sequential logic circuits, flip-flops, counters, registers, memory devices, and microprocessors. It is a continuation of the first part and is crucial for understanding digital system design, suitable for 4th semester computer technology students.

title: Computer Peripherals
author: Md. Mehedi Hasan
description: This textbook provides an in-depth understanding of various computer peripheral devices such as printers, scanners, monitors, input/output devices, and storage hardware. It is tailored for polytechnic students to gain real-world hardware knowledge and troubleshooting skills in computer systems.

title: Web Design & Development-1
author: Md. Sirajul Islam
description: Web Design & Development-1 focuses on HTML, CSS, and the fundamentals of responsive design. It helps students understand how websites are built and styled, with hands-on examples and layout practices that meet the curriculum requirements of diploma computer science students.

title: Data Structure & Algorithm
author: Md. Mojibur Rahman
description: Designed for diploma-level computer students, this book explains essential data structures like arrays, stacks, queues, linked lists, trees, and graphs, along with algorithm design techniques such as searching, sorting, and recursion. It includes real-world problems to enhance algorithmic thinking.

title: Business Organization & Communication
author: Narayon Chandra Bosak
description: This book provides a foundation in business management, communication methods, office practices, and organizational structure. It also covers official letter writing, reports, and professional etiquette to prepare students for administrative roles in IT firms and technical organizations.

title: Social Science
author: Md. Mostofa Zaman
description: Social Science introduces diploma students to the fundamentals of sociology, political science, and economics. It helps learners understand society, governance, civic responsibilities, and cultural structures, contributing to their overall development as responsible citizens and professionals.

title: Physics -2
author: Md. Al-Amin
description: Physics -2 is designed for third-semester diploma students and explores topics such as optics, waves, magnetism, electromagnetism, and basic thermodynamics. It builds on the foundation of Physics -1 and connects theoretical knowledge with real-world engineering applications.

title: Mathematics-3
author: Md. Mahbubur Rahman Khan
description: Mathematics-3 focuses on complex numbers, integral calculus, differential equations, and matrices. It is crafted for diploma engineering students to strengthen their problem-solving and analytical abilities, which are essential in computer science and technical subjects.

title: Digital Electronics-1
author: Eng. Kabir Mahmud
description: Digital Electronics-1 introduces the fundamentals of digital logic, binary systems, logic gates, Boolean algebra, and combinational circuits. This book is designed for CST students in diploma programs and serves as a solid base for more advanced digital and embedded systems.

title: Basic Application Development Using Python
author: Md. Al-Amin Mida
description: This book teaches the fundamentals of application development with Python. It covers GUI development, file management, modules, and practical use cases for small apps. Designed for diploma students, it builds practical programming skills with a project-based learning approach.

title: Computer Graphics Design-2
author: Eng. Towhid Hossen
description: Computer Graphics Design-2 is an advanced guide on visual design and graphics creation for CST students. It includes tools like Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and design principles. The book helps learners create visually appealing digital content for web, UI, and print media.

title: IT Support Service
author: Eng. Abdullah Ibne Nazim
description: IT Support Service covers essential technical support skills including hardware troubleshooting, OS installation, network setup, system maintenance, and customer communication. This book is ideal for CST students preparing for roles in IT helpdesk and support environments.

title: Accounting
author: Prof. Dr. Md. Hossain Ali, Md. Golam Rahman, Md. Sajjadul Islam, Md. Mahmud Hasan
description: This Accounting book for diploma students introduces key concepts in financial accounting, including journal entries, ledgers, balance sheets, and profit & loss accounts. It emphasizes practical applications in tech industry budgeting, financial tracking, and project cost analysis.

title: Application Development Using Java
author: Md. Mohsin Ali, Md. Sajjadul Islam, Md. Golam Rahman
description: Focused on practical development, this book guides students through building applications using Java. It includes topics like GUI, file handling, OOP principles, and real-world projects. Ideal for diploma students advancing their Java knowledge toward full-scale app development.

title: Web Design & Development - II
author: Arifin Islam
description: A continuation of the first part, this book teaches advanced web development techniques including responsive design, JavaScript enhancements, animation, and frameworks. It helps diploma students strengthen their front-end skills and prepare for professional-level web projects.

title: Computer Architecture & Microprocessor
author: Md. Mahbub Alam, Md. Golam Mostafa, Md. Abu Taleb, Md. Sakhawat Hossain
description: This book covers the fundamentals of computer architecture and microprocessor design, including instruction sets, memory organization, control units, and real-world microprocessor applications. It's tailored for 6th-semester diploma students in computer science and technology.

title: Data Communication
author: Md. Alamgir Hossain, Md. Abu Taleb, Md. Golam Mostafa, Md. Sakhawat Hossain
description: This textbook explains how data is transmitted over networks. Topics include OSI layers, transmission media, error control, multiplexing, and network protocols. It's written for diploma students to understand communication systems and prepare for IT and networking careers.

title: Operating System
author: Md. Alamgir Hossain, Md. Abu Taleb, Md. Golam Mostafa, Md. Sakhawat Hossain
description: This book introduces core concepts of operating systems including process management, memory handling, file systems, security, and scheduling. It's designed for diploma students to develop a deep understanding of how modern OS like Linux and Windows function internally.

title: Project Works - I
author: Engineer Md. Abul Kalam Azad
description: This book is focused on guiding students through project planning, documentation, and implementation. It encourages practical learning by helping diploma students complete a capstone project that demonstrates their cumulative technical knowledge and problem-solving skills.

title: Principles of Marketing
author: Md. Azim Uddin Sardar
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Industrial Management
author: Md. Masud Rana
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Database Management System
author: MD. Mahbub Alam
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Microcontroller Based System Design & Development
author: MD. Mahbub Alam
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Surveillance Security System
author: Md. Sakil Al Musa
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Web Development Project
author: Zahirul Quader Rana
description: Covers core topics for semester 5 students in CST discipline.

title: Basic Electronics
author: Md. Abdur Rahman
description: Basic Electronics is an essential textbook for diploma students studying electrical and computer technology. It covers the basics of current, voltage, resistance, semiconductors, diodes, transistors, and circuit design. This book builds foundational knowledge for advanced electronics courses.

title: Python Programming
author: Md. Mahbub Alam
description: This Python Programming book is tailored for diploma students. It covers basic syntax, variables, data types, loops, functions, file handling, and error handling. The content is beginner-friendly, with real-life programming tasks and practical examples aligned with the latest syllabus.

title: Chemistry
author: Md. Hasan
description: This textbook on Chemistry is ideal for diploma students, explaining atomic structure, chemical bonding, states of matter, acids and bases, and chemical equations. It is structured to develop a strong theoretical and practical base needed for further engineering-related chemistry studies.

title: Mathematics-2
author: Md. Deloyar Hossain
description: Mathematics-2 continues from the basics and includes calculus, algebra, and coordinate geometry relevant to diploma courses. The book provides clear explanations, solved examples, and practice problems to help students improve their analytical and problem-solving skills in engineering math.

title: Bangla-2
author: Md. Moshiur Rahman
description: Bangla-2 is designed for technical students to enhance their reading, writing, and comprehension skills in Bangla. The book includes essays, application writing, grammar rules, and practical communication strategies essential for both academic and professional communication in the local context.

title: English-2
author: Md. Yeasin Ali
description: English-2 strengthens students' command of the English language. It focuses on grammar, sentence structure, paragraph writing, reading comprehension, and vocabulary building. This book helps diploma students improve their academic English and prepares them for technical communication.

title: Physical Education
author: Rafiq Ahmed
description: This book on Physical Education promotes health awareness, physical fitness, and sportsmanship among students. It includes theoretical knowledge about the human body, fitness training, nutrition, and various sports activities aligned with the technical curriculum of the diploma program.
